alert.note: Alert for Bossier; Caddo (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 16 at 2:51PM CDT until July 16 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Louisiana and northeast Texas, including the following counties and parishes, in northwest Louisiana, Bossier and Caddo. In northeast Texas, Harrison and Marion. * WHEN...Until 500 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 250 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen in the last hour and a half. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch, with isolated higher amounts, are expected over the area over the next couple of hours. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Shreveport, Bossier City, Haughton, Blanchard, Benton, Mooringsport, Fosters, Eastwood, Ferguson, Dixie, Barksdale Air Force Base, Cross Lake, Red Chute, Linton, Bodcau, Sligo, Princeton, Fillmore, Bellevue and Bethany. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
